summary: This document is an email chain from August 30, 2021, discussing a Daily Beast news article about Prince Andrew's status in the Epstein investigation. The emails show internal U.S. government coordination regarding public statements and confirm that Prince Andrew was considered a 'person of interest' and witness by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Andrew
persons.role: Person of interest / witness in Epstein probe
persons.context: Referred to as Prince Andrew, the disgraced royal. The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York reported he was a 'person of interest' in the Epstein probe and considered 'at least' a witness, and they wanted to talk to him.

persons.name: Strauss
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York (USANYS)
persons.context: Sender of an email forwarding the news clipping, asking if the office took the action referenced in the article about Prince Andrew.

connections.description: Strauss's office (SDNY) identified Andrew as a person of interest and witness in the Epstein probe and sought to interview him.

events.title: SDNY reports Andrew as person of interest
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York reported that Prince Andrew was a 'person of interest' in the Epstein probe and was considered 'at least' a witness, piling pressure on him.

events.title: Daily Beast article on Prince Andrew
events.description: Publication of an article titled 'Prince Andrew's Gilded Cage Closes In as Department of Justice Reiterates Desire to Speak to Disgraced Royal', prompting internal government email discussion.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) had previously stated they wanted to talk to Prince Andrew but had not been able to.
In August 2021, the SDNY reported Prince Andrew was a 'person of interest' in the Epstein probe and was considered 'at least' a witness.
Internal U.S. government emails show coordination and review of public comments regarding the U.S.-U.K. relationship in the context of the Andrew inquiry.
Prince Andrew had repeatedly claimed he offered to cooperate with the inquiry, but the SDNY indicated they had not been able to speak with him.
